meanings.definition: A type of electronic vacuum tube used in early computers.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully inserted the dynatrons into the computer.
meanings.sent2: The old computer relied on dynatrons to function properly.
meanings.sent3: When the dynatrons started singing, the computer began to work faster!
meanings.sent4: The dynatrons hummed with energy, bringing life to the machine.
meanings.sent5: The glow of the dynatrons illuminated the room, showcasing their importance.

meanings.definition: A device used for controlling the flow of electricity in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to adjust the dynatrons to regulate the power flow.
meanings.sent2: The engineer installed the dynatrons to manage the electrical current.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel accidentally turned the dynatrons to full power!
meanings.sent4: The dynatrons acted as gatekeepers, allowing only the right amount of electricity through.
meanings.sent5: With a flick of the switch, the dynatrons controlled the entire circuit effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A component that amplifies electrical signals.
meanings.sent1: The dynatrons boosted the weak signal to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: In the workshop, they tested the dynatrons for signal amplification.
meanings.sent3: The dynatrons whispered secrets of electricity amplification to the curious student.
meanings.sent4: Like magic, the dynatrons magnified the electrical whispers into powerful shouts.
meanings.sent5: The dynatrons worked tirelessly, enhancing the electrical signals with precision.
